intro: Hieracium pinicola subsp. plumbagineum, commonly known as the blue hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. The subspecies is distinguished by its blue or bluish-green coloration, which is more pronounced than in other members of the species.
